question.subject: General English
question.text: Rearrange the sentences: 1. in public life 2. honesty is 3. indispensable 4. an essential quality

question.subject: General English
question.text: Change into indirect speech: He said, “I will help you provided you follow my advice.”
question.option: He said that he will help me provided I follow his advice
He said that he would help you if you followed your advice
He said that he would help me if I followed his advice
He says that he would help me provided I followed his advice
question.answer: He said that he would help me if I followed his advice

question.subject: General English
question.text: Choose the correctly punctuated sentence:
question.option: The officer said “Work honestly and fear none.”
The officer said, “Work honestly and fear none.”
The officer, said “Work honestly and fear none”.
The officer said “Work honestly, and fear none.”
question.answer: The officer said, “Work honestly and fear none.”

It is believed that the painting is priceless.
The painting is believed to be priceless.
That the painting is priceless is believed.
question.answer: The painting is believed to be priceless.

He said that it is a beautiful sight.
He exclaimed what a beautiful sight it was.
He exclaimed that what a beautiful sight!
question.answer: He exclaimed that it was a beautiful sight.

question.subject: Computer Awareness
question.text: Which of the following statements correctly distinguishes between supercomputers and quantum computers?
question.option: Both supercomputers and quantum computers operate on the same computing principles
Quantum computers are mainly used for routine data processing tasks
Supercomputers use qubits, while quantum computers use binary digits
Quantum computers perform calculations using qubits, whereas supercomputers rely on classical bits and massive parallel processing
question.answer: Quantum computers perform calculations using qubits, whereas supercomputers rely on classical bits and massive parallel processing

question.subject: General English

question.subject: General English
question.text: Targeting risk factors is key to reducing deaths due to cardiovascular diseases. The reinvention of the wheel can be painful. Taking lessons from those who have already run the wheel several revolutions and tweaking those lessons for domestic conditions might not be a bad idea. For India, there is indeed valuable learning from the results of the Prospective Urban Rural Epidemiology (PURE) study published in The Lancet this week. Studying the situation in 21 countries across five continents, categorised by income levels, researchers showed that while cardiovascular disease (CVD) is the leading cause for death overall, there have been some transitions, particularly in the high-income countries, which have managed to reduce the number of deaths from CVD. In low-income countries, including India, however, CVD is still the top killer, with death three times more frequent than that due to cancer. What flies in the face of logic is that the risk burden of CVD-linked mortality is inversely proportional — lower risk but higher mortality in low-income countries, and higher risk but lower mortality in high-income countries. PURE’s analysis concluded that the higher mortality in poorer countries was likely due to other factors, including ‘lower quality and less health care’. Access to affordable, quality health care is still a dream in many pockets in India. A great amount of out-of-pocket expenditure (according to Health Ministry data for 2014-15, nearly 62.6 % of India’s total health expenditure) often frustrates continuation of treatment, or adherence to drug regimens. While some States have shown limited successes with government-sponsored health insurance schemes, the Centre’s Ayushman Bharat Yojana will have to take much of the burden of hospitalisation for complications of non-communicable diseases. National and State schemes running on mission mode, including the National Programme for Prevention and Control of Cancer, Diabetes, CVD and Stroke will have to step up efforts to target people at risk with life-saving interventions. While most of the predominant risk factors for cardiovascular disease present no startling medical revelation, it is significant that the single largest risk factor is a low education level. It is no doubt part of the job description of the National Programme to modify this risk factor. However, governments will have to muscle up to tackle a rather startling finding — ambient air pollution and indoor air pollution have an impact on CVD and mortality. Household air pollution is the third top risk factor in low-income countries, according to the study. The need of the hour is out-of-the-box solutions combined with inspiration from models of those who seem to have belled this particular cat. Any plans that target the risk factors and prevent the onset of non-communicable diseases will clearly have to be truly game-changing, and incorporate the environmental angle as well. Which is still a dream in India as per the above passage?

question.subject: General English
question.text: Read the following statements and select the option as per the passage given above. Statement A: In India, CVD is the top killer as compared to Cancer. Statement B: The number of deaths due to CVD in the low-income countries is more than the number of deaths in the high-income countries.
question.option: Both the statements A and B are True.
Statement A is False and Statement B is True
Statement A is True and Statement B is False
Both the statements A and B are False
question.answer: Both the statements A and B are True.

question.subject: General English
question.text: Find the correct active/ passive voice for the given sentence in passive/ active voice from the given alternatives. She pressed the shirts neatly.
question.option: The shirts were pressed by her neatly.
The shirts are being pressed by her neatly.
The shirts are pressed by her neatly.
question.answer: The shirts were pressed by her neatly.

question.subject: General English
question.text: Which one of the following options correctly converts the sentence into indirect speech? Mohan said, "Close the window please. It is very cold."
question.option: Mohan told to me to close the window as it was very cold.
Mohan asked me if I could close the window as it was very cold.
Mohan asked me if I could close the window. It was very cold.
Mohan said to me to close the window as it was very cold.
question.answer: Mohan asked me if I could close the window as it was very cold.

He introduced Rs 30,000 as additional capital in February 2016. Find out the amount withdrawn by Mr B for his domestic expenses.

question.subject: Accounting & Bookkeeping
question.text: When a rational person makes a choice, the concept of opportunity cost enters, thus opportunity cost is defined as

options.option: the benefit gained in terms of the next best alternative foregone when a choice is made
the benefit lost in terms of the next best alternative foregone when a choice is made
the benefit lost in terms of the next best alternative gained when a choice is made
the benefit lost in terms of the next best alternative foregone when there is no choice at all

question.answer: the benefit lost in terms of the next best alternative foregone when a choice is made

options.option: Payment of liability Causes an increase in Owners equity
Purchase of an asset, either in cash or Credit, does not change the owners equity

The Collection of an Account Receivable will cause total assets to increase

question.answer: Purchase of an asset, either in cash or Credit, does not change the owners equity

question.subject: General English
question.text: Which of the following choices is the correct reported speech of the question statement? She said to her daughter, “Don ’t worry, everything shall be fine ”.

options.option: She told her daughter to not worry as everything should be fine.
She comforted her daughter asking her not to worry as everything shall be fine.
She advised her daughter to not to worry as everything was going to be fine.
She comforted her daughter telling her not to worry as everything would be fine.

question.answer: She comforted her daughter telling her not to worry as everything would be fine.

question.subject: General Economics
question.text: Marginal cost is defined as :

options.option: the change in total cost due to one unit change in output
total cost divided by total output
change in output due to one unit change in input
total product divided by quantity of inputs

question.answer: the change in total cost due to one unit change in output

question.subject: General Economics
question.text: Gross National disposable income is equal to:

options.option: Net National disposable income + Current replacement cost
Net National disposable income – Corporate profit tax
Gross National disposable income – Direct personal taxes
Gross National disposable income – Miscellaneous fees and fines paid by the households

question.answer: Net National disposable income + Current replacement cost

question.subject: General Economics
question.text: In case of law of variable proportions, point of inflexion is where:

options.option: TP starts declining because MP is negative
TP stops increasing at the increasing rate and starts increasing at the decreasing rate
MP is decreasing and TP is increasing at the increasing rate.
MP is increasing and TP is increasing at the increasing rate

question.answer: TP stops increasing at the increasing rate and starts increasing at the decreasing rate

question.subject: General Economics
question.text: What is Fiscal deficit?

options.option: It occurs when a government's total revenue exceeds the total expenditure excluding borrowings.
It is the difference between governments total receipts and its total expenditure including borrowings
It occurs when a government's total expenditure exceed the revenue that it generates, excluding money from borrowings

question.answer: It occurs when a government's total expenditure exceed the revenue that it generates, excluding money from borrowings

question.subject: General Economics
question.text: Which factor induces the movement of the economy from a point inside the production possibility curve to a point on it?

Partial employment of the given resources

question.answer: Fuller employment of the given resources

question.answer: Commodities offered for sales under perfect competition will be heterogeneous

Action and reaction act on the same body.

Action and Reaction forces are simultaneous.

question.answer: Action and reaction act on the same body.

question.answer: Temperature difference at different levels in the ocean

question.subject: English
question.text: In the following question, a pair of similar sounding words is provided. You are required to select the option that most appropriately describes the meaning of both the words and mark your response accordingly. ‘Vial’ and ‘Vile’

options.option: Vial means a small container and Vile means extremely unpleasant.
Vial means a huge container and Vile means extremely pleasant.
Vial means extremely pleasant and Vile means huge container.
Vial means extremely unpleasant and Vile means small container

question.answer: Vial means a small container and Vile means extremely unpleasant.

question.subject: English
question.text: In the question given below, there is a sentence with jumbled up parts. Rearrange these parts that are labelled P, Q, R and S to produce a grammatically correct and coherent sentence. The parents__________ P. when they were in France Q. to their three children R. for 7 years S. could not teach Kashmiri

question.subject: English
question.text: In the following question, a sentence has been given in direct/indirect speech. Out of the four alternatives suggested, select the one which best expresses the same sentence in direct/indirect speech. He said, “I was writing an application to the mayor about the pathetic condition of road”.

options.option: He said that we was writing an application to the mayor about the pathetic condition of the road.
He said that he has been writing an application to the mayor about the pathetic condition of road.
He said that he had been writing an application to the mayor about the pathetic condition of the road.
He said that he had written an application to the mayor about the pathetic condition of the road.

question.answer: He said that he had been writing an application to the mayor about the pathetic condition of the road.

question.subject: English
question.text: Convert the following sentence into passive voice: They first sun-dried the garbage for one to three days to bring down the moisture level.

options.option: The garbage was first sun-dried for one to three days to bring down the moisture level.
The moisture level of the garbage came down when it was sun-dried for one to three days.
One to three days of sun-drying brought down the moisture level of the garbage.
The moisture level was brought down by sun-drying the garbage for one to three days.

question.answer: The garbage was first sun-dried for one to three days to bring down the moisture level.

question.subject: Statistics
question.text: If two attributes are positively associated, what does it mean?

options.option: Both the attributes are absent together.
Both the attributes are present together.
One attribute is present and the other is absent.
Both the attributes are either present or absent together.

question.answer: Both the attributes are either present or absent together.
